result.execSummary:
The defendant Dan J. Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Cts.6 & 9 in file 16CF561 but Consecutive to Extended Supervision on Ct.5 in file 16CF561.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug.  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  128 - PSI reviewed by all parties. Sentence recommendations. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions consecutive to ES on Ct5 in 16CF561 but concurrent to Cts 6, 9 in 16CF561.  Court costs ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  No restitution requested.  Firearms warning, Voters rights, Appeal rights given.
